def.dt: :of or relating to schools and education She received awards for her academic achievements/accomplishments. I spent my academic career at one school. The board set tough academic standards for graduation. He was offered a teaching job and decided to return to academic life.

:having no practical importance :not involving or relating to anything real or practical His interest in sailing is purely academic. He's not a sailor himself. It was a question of only academic [=theoretical] interest.
:good at studying and at passing exams :good at academics He's not very academic, but he's good with his hands.

utxt.vi: He did well enough academically to be accepted at many colleges.

def.dt: :a person who is a teacher in a college or university The book appeals to academics and to the general public.
:courses of study taken at a school or college She excelled at academics. He only cares about sports. He has no interest in academics.
:the time during a year when a school has classes In the U.S., the academic year usually begins in September and ends in May or June.
